intro: Stenocalyx bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Stenocalyx bahiensis is adapted to tropical climates and thrives in well-drained soils.
